poem:
Dance of Discovery

In Tesco's aisles—a melody stirs,  
British beats meld with south Asian swirls,  
plastic-wrapped echoes of morning light,  
unfurling in rhythm—pavement's delight.  

A record spins—life's tapestry anew,  
notes weaving bridges 'tween stars and roots;  
an indie heart, each pulse ignites,  
to Earth, Wind, and Fire, the world alights.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘If you don’t dance to Earth, Wind and Fire, there’s something wrong with you’: Himesh Patel’s honest playlist The first single I boughtBefore I became an indie kid and got into Arctic Monkeys, Maxïmo Park and Bloc Party, there was this explosion of British/south Asian music in the early 00s, so I bought Dance With You (Nachna Tere Naal) by Rishi Rich Project featuring Jay Sean and Juggy D from Tesco Extra. It felt like". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
